head.title: How to configure cvs in Netbeans

section.description:
Here is the procedure get the GP module stored on our cvs server from Netbeans.
1) First of all you must enable the version control module:
From the Netbeans IDE choose the Tools\option menu item. It will popup the following options dialog box.
Then select the IDE configuration\System\Modules\Version Control item.
Check the Enabled property is set to true.(set it if false)
2) Set the cvs parameters:
From the Netbeans IDE choose the Versioning\Mount Version Control\CVS menu item.
It will popup the following dialog box. Then enter your working directory path and press the Next button.
Then enter the CVS connection parameters as shown below and press the Next button. . Select Password Server
. Server name pcslux9.cern.ch
. User name [Your_user_name]
. Repository /home/cvs/cvsroot
Choose Use Built-in cvs client and press the Next button.
Type your password to login and press the login button. Then press the Next button.
Check the box to checkout the copy of the repository to your working directory and press the Finish button.
A new dialog box will popup. Press the Select Module button to choose the GP module and press the OK buttons to close the dialog boxes.
The following dialog box will then appear, showing the checkout progress.
When seeing Finished in the status bar, then press the Close button... that's it !
